title: Easy Rib Eye Roast Recipe
description: Rib-eye roast on the bone is always a crowd-pleaser. This easy five-ingredient recipe is a snap to prepare and carves up tender, juicy, and delicious.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Roast Recipes Easy Rib Eye Roast 4.8 (231) 202 Reviews 60 Photos I make this rib-eye roast on the bone every time rib eyes are on sale. Easy and delicious; there are never any leftovers! We usually cook ours medium-rare. Submitted by Kendall Christine Hanson Updated on November 13, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 60 60 60 60 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 40 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 cup softened butter 6 cloves garlic, minced 1 (4 pound) bone-in rib-eye roast sea salt and cracked black pepper to taste Directions Gather all ingredients and preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat butter and garlic together in a bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Poke several holes in rib eye with a sharp knife. Rub butter mixture all over meat and season with salt and pepper. Place rib eye fat-side up in a roasting pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Roast in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and continue cooking until rib eye is reddish-pink and juicy in the center, 1 1/2 to 2 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center will read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C) for medium. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 614 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 472 Calories 40g Fat 1g Carbs 27g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 472 % Daily Value * Total Fat 40g 51% Saturated Fat 21g 105% Cholesterol 186mg 62% Sodium 257mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 1g 0% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Protein 27g 54% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 32mg 2% Iron 3mg 14% Potassium 349mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Rib Eye Roast 01 of 60 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 60 Photo by  Denise Atomic_Gamer Leeper 03/02/2024 Worth the effort Great flavors Easy to follow A keeper! 03 of 60 Photo by  Kymm 01/20/2023 Soooo easy!! I used 3 X's as much garlic (cause that's how we roll). Cooked 120 mins (at 325) for perfect Med-rare roast. 04 of 60 Photo by  Wendee Sampson Garvin 12/30/2022 It was very easy 05 of 60 Photo by  FunPho6188 12/26/2022 OMG, this roast came out perfectly! I made it for Christmas dinner. My family loved it. The meat was so tender. 06 of 60 Photo by  TenTacos 12/15/2022 This came out perfect! 07 of 60 Photo by  RosyCurd6112 11/06/2022 This is the second time I have used this Recipe. Both times it came out Excellent! It turned out so Juicy and Tender. We chose the Bone-In Ribeye Roast 4 pounds. Plenty of Leftovers for me and my Husband. 08 of 60 Photo by  GrittySauce1055 04/18/2022 My favorite steak is a ribeye so I figured I should try doing a ribeye roast this Easter. This being my first, I began Googling and ended up here (thankfully).Prep was simple, made a garlic butter spread and generously lathered it up while my oven heated to 500 degrees. Some salt and coarse pepper followed then I seared it for 20 minutes on the dot, then decreased it to 325. The last thing I wanted was to overcook this baby. Alexa pitched in and set my first timer then we waited. I followed someones advise to pull it at 125 degrees then tented it for 20 minutes. Sure enough, worked like a charm! Thanks for the tip!I will definitely be doing this again, easy peasy and delicious! 09 of 60 Photo by  BBQ'd Fish 12/25/2020 This turned out AWESOME. Very Delicious. Followed the recipe 100% A great Merry Christmas dinner 10 of 60 Photo by  stlowr 12/08/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Easy Sous Vide Corned Beef Grilled Tri-Tip Roast 25 Ratings Roast Beef Tenderloin 165 Ratings Standing Roast Beef (Brined) 34 Ratings Easy Standing Rib Roast 20 Ratings Coffee Roast 78 Ratings Tri Tip Roast 72 Ratings Herbed and Spiced Roasted Beef Tenderloin 68 Ratings Ox Roast 10 Ratings Fabulous Beef Tenderloin 764 Ratings Garlic Prime Rib 2,368 Ratings Wine-Braised Beef Brisket 212 Ratings Grilled Tri-tip Roast 25 Ratings Roast with Gravy 132 Ratings Slow-Cooked Beef Loin Tri-Tip Roast 37 Ratings Instant Pot® Mississippi Roast 37 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
